intro: Racosperma clydonophorum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, bright yellow flowers are arranged in dense, globular clusters. Racosperma clydonophorum is often used in reforestation and land stabilization due to its hardy nature.
